H0.text: Infiltration is the name of the process in the water cycle shown by label 1.

H1.text: Evaporation is the name of the process in the water cycle shown by label 1.

H2.text: Condensation is the name of the process in the water cycle shown by label 1.

H3.text: Precipitation is the name of the process in the water cycle shown by labelÂ 1.

A4.text: The processes that drive these movements, or fluxes, are evaporation, transpiration, condensation, precipitation, sublimation, infiltration, surface runoff, and subsurface flow.

A5.text: Evaporation is an essential part of the water cycle.

A6.text: The sun (solar energy) drives evaporation of water from oceans, lakes, moisture in the soil, and other sources of water.

A7.text: The word most often refers to the water cycle.

A8.text: Condensation is usually associated with water.
